oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ritual of the Farmer's Alliance
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farmers' groups; Farmers; Fraternal organizations; Political organizations
Agriculture; National Farners' Alliance and Industrial Union; Nashville (Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A small soft-cover booklet detailing the ritual for the installation of new members into the Farmers' Alliance. The booklet has been sewn together.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Farmers' Alliance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Farmers' Alliance made its first appearance in Tennessee in the winter of 1887. In March 1888 farmers organized the Tennessee State Alliance and elected John P. Buchanan, a Rutherford County livestock man, as the first president. In 1889 the Farmers' Alliance joined the Agricultural Wheel to become the National Farmers' and Laborers' Union. The Alliance urged farmers to adopt scientific and business practices, diversify their crops, and become self-sufficient in order to break the debt cycle.
